Description: Petróleos Mexicanos (trademarked and better known as Pemex) is a Mexican state-owned petroleum company, created in 1938 by nationalized
Full Description: Petróleos Mexicanos (trademarked and better known as Pemex) is a Mexican state-owned petroleum company, created in 1938 by nationalized petroleum and the expunging of all private foreign and domestic companies at that time. Pemex is the biggest enterprise in Mexico, the largest taxpayer in the country and one of the largest companies in Latin America. Of the few oil companies in the world that develops all the productive chain of the industry, from exploration to distribution and commercialization of end products, including petrochemicals. During 2012, Pemex had an operating income of 905 billion pesos and investment amounted to 311 billion pesos. The crude oil production has remained stable in recent years, and additional discoveries were conducted that helped corroborate the petroleum potential deepwater basins. With the completion of the well-1DL Kunah Kunah more field information was obtained, confirming the gas potential in the deepwater Gulf of Mexico project B.  The business plan of Pemex and its subsidiaries want, over the course 2013-2017, to meet the mandate of creating value and achieving operational and financial sustainability in the medium and long term. From a careful examination of the current situation and the situation analysis, we have decided to focus on the following objectives: growth, operational efficiency, corporate responsibility and management modernization.

The idea was born while they were pursuing a master's degree in business at Stanford University (California, USA) and after several months of hard work in September 2009 they began their operations to become the first credit repair company in Mexico. Resuelve emerges as a company capable of resolving the unpayable debts of thousands of Mexicans who were victims of over-indebtedness registered between the years 2002 to 2009. In Resuelve we understand the great need of Mexicans to have a reliable advisor to help them solve their financial problems . At the same time, we are able to repair the past due loans of banks, which has suffered a great deterioration in recent years.

Full Description: Welcome to Truekx, the largest platform for exchanging Goods and Services! The application is also very useful because you can access thousands of businesses that accept exchange in Truekx and you will pay less cash for your consumption. We will position your business: For thousands of affiliates to look for you to do business. You will save cash flow: Paying with Truekx exchange. ES: Nuestro modelo de negocio es una plataforma alternativa de pago, potencializando a nuestros afiliados ( clientes usuarios) brindando conexiones para realizar negocios en una interfaz limpia, eficiente para hacer negocios face-to face, y que puedan pagar con sus propios productos y servicios que son parte de su negocio!! De esta forma tiene a su alcance una red de cientos de miles de empresarios y sus empresas para hacer negocios, nuestro negocio los canaliza y vigila para que se genere en un ámbito seguro y controlado, donde captamos sus recursos y estandarizamos estos para que tengan un valor determinado equivalente para todas las partes involucradas, tanto compradores como vendedores realizarán sus operaciones en nuestra plataforma de forma segura y eficiente, contando un respaldo de la parte que hicieron negocios esté resguardada por nuestra aplicación para que esos recursos sean usados en cuanto lo requieran, una ves que realicen el pago de nuestra comisión por el manejo de la consolidación del negocio!

We make it possible to get professional fitness training from top coaches without leaving your home for less than half the price of the cheapest gym.    We produce awesome long format workouts led by the world’s best trainers from yoga to functional training to treadmill workouts, with new content published every week and available offline for unparalleled flexibility The InstaFit app was launched in late 2016 and has paying users in 37 countries. Industries: Assistive Technology, Consumer Electronics, Mobile, Wearables
Description: Sunu creates enabling technology to empower the visually impaired with freedom of mobility.
Full Description: Sunu Band is an award-winning technology - created with the purpose of enabling the senses, improving awarness and mobility for those living with impaired vision. Sunu band is a sonar smartband that improves navigation for the visually impaired. Sunu band combines sonar or echolocation with gentle precise vibrations to inform the user about objects or obstacles within their environment. The band, emits a high-frequency sound wave that bounces off of objects that the user encounters. The resulting vibratory pattern changes depending on how close or far away the object is to the user. Sunu band augments awareness of the user’s personal space, reduces unwanted accidents and ultimately improves confidence while providing a more fluid and enjoyable mobility. Users of Sunu Band wear it in conjunction with the cane or guide dog to augment awareness and complement mobility by detecting obstacles to the body and head in way that's discreet and unobtrusive.
Industry Groups: Consumer Electronics, Hardware, Health Care, Mobile
Founders: Cuauhtli Padillas, Fabiola Suárez, Fernando Albertorio, Marco Trujillo

The model is simple but disruptive and elegant, because everyone can publish or request everything for rent, so everyone can earn extra money without having to sell their belongings, or on the other hand, everyone can also get what they need at better prices. Description: Promote biodigesters to promote sustainable agriculture. We transform manure into renewable energy and organic fertilizer.
Full Description: Sistema Biobolsa fabricates and sells a patented high quality biodigester system and promotes education and capacity building. Our clients save money, time, and improve their quality of life by treating waste and producing energy and fertilizer. By fabricating a durable good with standard sizes, providing a high direct margin and promotional tools, we can grow through existing distribution networks to a large market. Divided in three segments: 1) subsistence farmers living on less than $2/day with low purchasing power in rural areas with a few animals and farmland; 2) rural small farmers that have agricultural production for consumption and commercialization, who have improved purchasing power and limited access to micro-credit; 3) medium-scale farmers that have commercial agricultural operations, higher purchasing power, access to credit but are still too small for an industrial scale biodigester system. There are 400 million of these farmers worldwide with 5 million in Mexico, Central America, and the Caribbean. We aim to serve 6-10 thousand per year in 3-5 years. Sistema Biobolsa provides a robust piece of farm infrastructure that acts as a waste treatment, energy production, and fertilizer system that can have deep health, economic, and environmental benefits for the end users. With a full package of technology, products, methodology, and promotion, we offer a large opportunity for entrepreneurs that want to distribute and sell Sistema Biobolsa in their local markets.

Industries: Blockchain, Contact Management, Document Management, E-Signature
Description: Legally secured contracts on the Blockchain
Full Description: Mifiel is the most trusted e-signature SaaS solution in Mexico. The platform has been entrusted to secure legal documents of hundreds of organizations including multinational banks and Fortune 500 companies. The advanced e-signatures* generated by Mifiel are presumed to be authentic in court unless the signer can prove otherwise, giving it advantage over any other e-signature standard or even autograph signatures. As such, Mifiel provides a more legally robust alternative to widely used e-signature platforms that are better suited to the legal systems in the U.S. and the U.K. Mifiel is also the first platform in the world to enable the secure electronic transfer of endorsable documents (e.g. negotiable instruments such as promissory notes, titles, etc.) by leveraging blockchain technology. *An advanced e-signature is akin to a digital identification card issued by the government, often associated to the biometric data of the individual to which it belongs. It is composed of a cryptographic key pair (provided as files or as files embedded within a chip in an ID card) that allows the individual to securely authenticate their identity and sign documents digitally. There are over 60 countries in the world that emit such signatures, most notably in Mexico, the EU, and East Asia.
Industry Groups: Information Technology, Other, Privacy and Security, Software
Founders: Genaro Madrid, Hannah Kim, Rodrigo González del Cueto, Tomas Alvarez
Top 5 Investors: Digital Currency Group, Tim Draper, KF Ventures, Alejandro Ozerkovsky

Description: OPI is an analytics platform that leverages on external and operational data to develop vertical solutions for complex business problems.
Full Description: Organizations in developing countries face complex intelligence problems. Given the high costs of analytics solutions, most have traditionally relied on intuition to solve these problems. When they do invest in sophisticated analysis, it usually relies entirely on internal or external data, with very few solutions focused on intelligence derived from the crossing of both; necessary to resolve many business problems. This translates into sub-optimal decisions that cost millions, despite the data for better decisions being available. OPI provides actionable intelligence derived from crossing large volumes and varieties of operational & external data: • Data-Warehouse -+10,000 variables – demographics, economic activity, business, real estate, urban infrastructure, news/events, social media – generated with data from hundreds of sources, (ie. government, web scraping, social media, private suppliers). • Intelligence – Proprietary variables and large variety of mathematical/statistical models applied to particular business problems. • Visualization/Exploration tool – Web-apps to explore intelligence outputs dynamically and with intuitive visualizations. Concrete solutions in current verticals: • Public sector – Integration of hundreds of demographic, social and economic datasets for generating indicators of social needs, which serve as demand proxies for public spending. Web-app with cartographic and chart visualizations of relevant variables. • Retail – Predictive model for sales in new openings, generated from historical, current and projected operational and external variables. From a web-app, users run the model to find regions with optimal conditions and predict sales for potential openings. The solution is sold through a SaaS model, with monthly/annual subscriptions for access to a web application; with the option of an implementation at the start.

Description: Oncovision is a Spanish technologic startup focusing in the molecular vision applied to health sciences sector.
Full Description: Oncovision (GEM Imaging S.A.) is a Spanish technologic start-up company created in 2003 with the initiative of the Corpuscular Physics Institute (CSIC) and the University of Valencia. They work in Molecular Vision applied to Health Sciences focusing in: cancer diagnosis and treatment, and advanced research in neurology, oncology, and cardiology. They are a company focused on Molecular Vision, which creates, develops and markets new medical technologies, global innovations with relevant clinical and economic advantages, often representing a breakthrough in current standards of diagnosis and treatment. ONCOVISION´s original, fresh technology, strong intellectual property, top-level clinical evidence, leading global reference centers, and pioneering protocols, is supported by its dynamic cross-functional team. ONCOVISION is opening unprecedented options in the treatment of cancer and serious cardiac and neurological diseases. Their team and the company’s technologies have been recognized by Spanish and European prestigious institutions. In 2007, the company was selected as one of the “20 Best Technologic Companies in Spain” and won the “National Medical Physics 2007 Congress Award” In 2008, it was one of the “20 Best Health Technology Companies in Europe” by the prestigious European Technology Tour, as well as finalist in the “National 25th Aniversary Enisa Award” Prof. Jose María Benlloch, active member of the company, won in 2008, the well-known “Jaime I” award. Scientists, technicians, and technologists of ONCOVISION have dozens of publications and presentations at scientific and medical conferences worldwide. Their shareholding, based in Valencia, was strengthened in August 2006 by the Spanish venture capital firm Bullnet, unifying its proven track in technological and management capabilities with companies in Spain and Portugal. The company is managed by a multi-task professional team with international experience. With proven clinical and scientific results, differentiated technology with enormous potential for future technological and financial capacity, intellectual property and developing lines, ONCOVISION is today ahead in the Spanish and European Health Industry.

Description: Crowd-lending platform for residential and commercial solar systems
Full Description: Red Girasol Crowdfunding platform for residential and commercial solar systems in Mexico. It connects people who wish to acquire a panel system with investors willing to contribute money until they complete the amount they need to pay for it in exchange for immediate returns. For their part, residents get the benefit of paying month to month at interest rates lower than those offered by other companies in the market. The company, through an algorithm, first analyzes the light receipt that the user shares and, based on this, presents a quotation plan with different installers in agreement with Girasol. By choosing the one that best suits your needs, the resident must provide at least 10% of the total price. Then start the funding campaign and once the goal is completed, the installation happens. From there, the company charges the user's credit card the payment of the monthly payment to investors, whose interest and yield are assigned to both depending on the hitch and term selected in the case of the first and the amount contributed in the case of the second. Girasol obtains profits by charging commissions to the three actors in its network (residents, investors and suppliers). The company started its operation in 2016 in Monterrey, Nuevo León.

Description: Remote interpretation of imagenology and specialized studies.
Full Description: NUBIX stores and remotely interprets specialty studies connecting specialist with clinics, hospitals, laboratories and public and private cabinets, insurers and patients. We support the diagnosis by managing, storing and interpreting studies of specialty in 3 simple steps: storage of studies, access to studies from anywhere and interpretation of the study at any time.  We improve the communication systems available between clinics and hospitals with medical specialists. Our focus is on 3 areas: insurers that seek to reduce their costs based on the reduction of mounted claims, clinics and public and private hospitals that do not have a radiologist or other specialist in their staff, to the public health sector as a third party authorized for distance interpretation and patients who are seeking a second medical opinion about their medical procedures. During its first year of operations (2018) NUBIX serves more than 39,000 patients including more than 35,000 patients for the early detection of breast cancer. Times of up to 25 hours for patient care are achieved through NUBIX compared to other options that take more than a month to perform the interpretation, this is very important since with most types of cancer Breast division takes one to two months, that is, the lesion doubles in size from a treatable finding to a high-risk one.

Description: America Movil is a Mexican telecommunications corporation that a range provides wireless voice and data services.
Full Description: América Móvil, S.A.B. de C.V. (AMX), is Latin America´s largest wireless company and, in terms of equity subscribers the third largest wireless provider in the world.  SMS (short message service), MMS (multimedia message service), mobile connection, localization services, info, entertainment, internet access, and BlackBerry:tm: service are just some of the wireless voice and data services that América Móvil provides.  The company was formed in September 2000 as a result of a spin-off from Telmex (Teléfonos de México S.A. de C.V.), Mexico’s largest provider of local and long-distance telephone services. At that time, América Móvil had operations in México, Guatemala, Ecuador and the United States and was serving approximately 10.1 million customers.  América Móvil now operates in eighteen countries and has a total subscriber base of 182.7 million. Since its inception, the company has expanded quickly through a combination of organic growth and acquisitions. América Móvil has had very accelerated subscriber growth for the last years and has increased its market share in the region from the low twenties in 2000 to more than 42% in the fourth semester of 2008. Within this frame, licensed POPs in Latin America went from 137 million to 500 million.

Description: iVoy offers businesses and individuals with a range of delivery and logistics services.
Full Description: iVoy is the first online delivery service in Mexico within 90 minutes you can monitor in real time from the comfort of your smartphone or computer. Through a business model based on collaborative economy (Crowdsourcing) and by technological developments (app and web) they provide the fastest and efficient logistics to their customers while generating new jobs that allows independent financial support to vulnerable social groups or individuals searching to generate an extra income. If you are an E-commerce looking to make same-day deliveries to meet and engage your customers, you have an offline business model  and you need to manage your product shipments, supplies, and documents; or you are an individual who needs to send or collect an item on specific in 90 minutes or less, iVoy is for you. We were born in 2011 as an offline start-up whose goal was to facilitate the logistics service in such a chaotic and complicated place like Mexico City, today we moved their operations to online platforms whose mission is to revolutionize the market for local deliveries through app digital systems and web, using the GPS technology we provide a system of real-time tracking of sent packages, allowing us to provide maximum satisfaction and confidence to their customers and their deliveries. Currently, iVoy makes deliveries in Mexico City and Guadalajara and projects a rapid national and international expansion. It has more than 250 motorcyclists associated, micro-entrepreneurs who are owners of a motorcycle to which they are given the opportunity to obtain a source of income between 14 and 15 thousand pesos per month and the possibility to get integrated into the formal economy. iVoy is available for iOS systems and is expected to release the Android version in late February 2016.

Description: Social Me is the real time platform that allow to professionals find, schedule and pay easily for world class expert advice
Full Description: Social Me is the real time platform that allow to professionals and entrepreneurs find, schedule and pay easily for world class expert advice to grow their businesses. We connect them, over the phone, for advice on their business challenges. Customers also can access to the range of courses that experts oered as part of the Social Me learning experience. Our Mission is to make Social Media and Digital Marketing advisors available every time and everywhere for entrepreneurs, professionals and business managers who want to empower themselves with the best digital skills to improve their competitiveness in the labor market. Problem 1- Time is a scarce commodity. We nd it hard to concentrate. We live stressed by the amount of information we have to process. 2- The speed of change threatens our competitiveness and requires us to inform and to form steadily. 3- New digital Professions arise every day for business innovation, creating a growing gap between what we know and what we need to know to remain competitive. 4- We do not know where to nd quality experts to help us understand the new paradigms of the digital economy. The University can not follow the speed with which the changes occur. Value proposition Social Me oer a monthly-based advisory services including access to the advisors network, online courses and workshops, real-time consultation, upgrade talks and tips, in a social an collaborative environment. Our business is based on providing people the opportunity to develop their digital inuence, and thus can competitively bind to the new digital economy way. Without this knowledge, the competitiveness of their companies is compromised allowing new competitors to gain market share in the new economy, digital, and with millions of new consumers who live hyper connected and expressing new commercial consumption habits. In a world where every time we have less time and less able to concentrate, we connects professionals and entrepreneurs with top advisors & industry experts through a marketplace of most Latin- Americans world class experts ever. Bussiness Model Social Me generates revenue by charging: Twenty percent in commissions of calls to experts. Fifty dollars in each training program that each expert oers to customers. (video training). 400 dollars for each each expert certication program oers to customers. (live classes that give in three months). Free access to webinars, tips and forums. Potential Market The online training market is projected at $ 2.2 billion for 2016 only in Latin America according to the report introduced by Docebo this year. Target Professionals between 35 and 45 years working in areas of communication, marketing, and sales that feel the need to reinvent itself and regain competitiveness they have lost in this new digital economy. They are seeking to become digital generalists and gain knowledge that allows them to think of new digital business strategies and be able to relate to the new young specialists. Millennians and empowered entrepreneurs who are naturally digital and looking to specialize in new platforms and communication technologies, social networks and digital marketing. Diferentiation Real time training platform that makes Social Media and Digital Marketing advisors available at any time, 24 hours a day. We oer our customers personalized service and mentoring to help to quickly learn to solve their problems and increase sales with new digital communication tools. Experience unique and emotional learning. Easy, fast, anytime, anywhere. Communities of practice and collaboration with professionals from over 15 countries. Achievements Billing UD $ 200,000 p/year in the first stage. Over 1500 professionals certified payments that means 22,000 solved courses. Over 50,000 users tested our courses as Free. More than 60,000 professionals talk with us on our social networks. The largest network of expert teachers on digital issues in Latin America. First Online training model based on collaborative and smart Learning Communities. Investments Incubator at the Catholic University of Chile: 120K StartUp Mexico: 60K

Description: Kuarti is a Mexican company that is part of the business accelerator with which Airbnb started
Full Description: Kuarti is a Mexican company that is part of the business accelerator with which Airbnb started. Kuarti is building the OYO of Latin America. The founder equates the current hotel booking process in Latin America to what it looked like decades ago in the U.S. Kuarti identified a trend of increasing demand to travel within Mexico’s growing middle class. However, there are currently no standardized hotel options in the country. Kuarti wants to provide another hotel booking option for standardized hotel chains that can be reserved online. The company wants to partner with independent hotels, to make small renovations and offer rooms for $35 per night. They’ve partnered with four hotels, have 20 rooms in their inventory and say that users have already booked 275 nights collectively. The founder identifies this as a $2.5 billion market in Mexico alone, and an $11 billion market across all of Latin America, where it hopes to expand. Kuarti is a Mexican company that is part of the business accelerator with which Airbnb started.

Description: FileHippo enables users to download the latest versions of free software by providing them with relevant links and information on updates.
Full Description: FileHippo is an online website that enables users to download the latest versions of free software by providing them with relevant links and information on updates. The website contains software updates under various categories such as browsers, messaging, file transfer, anti-malware, security, system tuning, networking, multimedia, desktop, and more. The website has a filtering feature that allows users to view only freeware and non-beta software. It provides RSS feeds for all updates, categories, and for individual programs. Along with the new updates, FileHippo also keeps the old versions of programs. The FileHippo App Manager scans users’ computers for installed applications, checks the versions, and then sends this data to FileHippo.com to ascertain if there are any newer releases available. If there are any new releases, then they are displayed in the browser window to be downloaded.

Description: GEPP is the only beverage company in Mexico with nationwide operations and full capabilities in manufacturing, distribution and marketing.
Full Description: GEPP is the only beverage company in Mexico with nationwide operations and full capabilities in manufacturing, distribution and marketing. The company produces, sells and distributes carbonated and non-carbonated soft drinks as well as water jugs in bulk sizes. GEPP is the exclusive bottler of PepsiCo trademark beverages in Mexico, and also develops and markets its own beverage brands and distributes third-party brands.  GEPP produces, sells and distributes world-renowned PepsiCo brands of carbonated and non-carbonated soft drinks, such as Pepsi Cola, Pepsi Light, 7Up, Lipton, Mirinda and Gatorade. GEPP also produces and owns local brands of carbonated, non-carbonated beverages and water jugs, such as Trisoda, Epura, Electropura, Santorini, Spin and Junghanns. In certain markets, GEPP sells third-party brands, such as juices under the Jumex Fresh brand and soft drinks under the Squirt, Canada Dry and Jarritos brands.  As of September 30, 2012, GEPP had 112 production lines in 44 production and bottling facilities, including 72 soft drink production lines, with 64 lines dedicated to non-returnable bottles and 7 lines dedicated to returnable bottles, and 40 water jugs production lines. GEPP’s soft drink production lines and its water jugs production lines have an aggregate annual production capacity of approximately 1,597.4 million eight-ounce cases and approximately 905.7 million eight-ounce cases, respectively.
Industry Groups: Consumer Goods, Food and Beverage, Manufacturing, Sales and Marketing

Description: Yana is a Spanish speaking app that accompanies people on the path to emotional well-being through strategies based on CBT.
Full Description: Yana is a Spanish speaking app that accompanies people on the path to emotional well-being.  It uses Cognitive Behavioral Therapy tools and presents them in a friendly, simple and intelligent way to help anyone who wants to manage their emotional state, any day at any time.  The app allows them to vent, change bad thoughts, create new healthy habits, or track the progress of how they feel. In short, it helps them change the way they think so that, consequently, they can change the way they feel. On the other hand, it also offers a space to find mental health professionals or crisis hotlines.  Yana seeks to be the first step towards the conversation of mental health so that people can, if they need it, have the confidence to go to the right professionals in the least amount of time possible.

Description: rubberit is a Condom subscription/donation platform
Full Description: Rubberit is a condom subscription service that matches every purchase with donations to disadvantaged sectors.  Unplanned pregnancies and the spread of STIs are at an all-time high and continue increasing worldwide. 45% of all pregnancies are unplanned, and nearly 500 million new cases of STIs are registered every year. Millions more go unreported.  The main reason behind this is a lack of access to condoms.  Systemic impediments, such as struggling education channels or rooted taboos obscure discussion when it comes to sexuality; for a staggering number of people, obtaining condoms can be a daunting task. This paradigm is not exclusive to developing countries. Rubberit is attacking this situation head on. Their members receive a monthly delivery of condoms, with as much discretion as their privacy-needs elicit. Simultaneously, the same amount of condoms purchased through this platform is taken by rubberit to communities under precarious economic conditions in their pilot country, Mexico.  Those donations are accompanied with a campaign of sexual health and education that leaves a long-lasting, tangible benefit to these remote localities. Their expanding client-base consists of incensed young men and women who want to take control of their sexual and reproductive rights. By becoming members of rubberit, they become agents of change, providing much-needed protection to complete strangers who oftentimes can't afford it.  To date, together, rubberit and their members, through their "Buy One, Give One" model have positively impacted the lives of thousands.
Industry Groups: Commerce and Shopping, Community and Lifestyle, Education, Health Care

Description: The second-largest gym company in Latin America
Full Description: Bodytech, the second-largest gym company in Latin America, was created in 1997 by Nicolás Loaiza and Gigliola Aycardi as part of their MBA graduation project for the University of the Andes in Bogota, Colombia.  Currently, it has more than 75 locations in Colombia, 18 in Peru, and 48 in Chile.  Its aim is to help more people in Latin America improve their health and well-being through exercise and improved nutrition.  Bodytech's offerings include full service gyms, high performance gyms, gyms for children and Life Fitness gym products sold for personal and commercial use.  Bodytech is focused on building full-service gym locations across Latin America with offerings such as advanced cardio and weight training, group fitness classes, swimming pools, saunas and spa services.  In addition, Bodytech has a network of doctors, physiotherapists, and nutritionists to provide integrated health services to its members.  Bodytech is an active member of Endeavor, the leading high-impact entrepreneurship network around the world.  Aycardi and Loaiza were nominees to the World Entrepreneur of the Year Award from Ernst & Young in 2015.

Description: Mexican conglomerate of hotels and resorts
Full Description: Founded in 1974 by Daniel Chávez Morán, Grupo Vidanta is Mexico and Latin America's premier tourism developer, specializing in vacation destinations, hotel brands, golf courses, real estate and entertainment. The company's visionary approach to the development of luxury beach destinations brings vacation dreams to life via resorts and entertainment across Mexico's most sought-after locations—Nuevo Vallarta, Riviera Maya, Los Cabos, Acapulco, Puerto Peñasco, Puerto Vallarta and Mazatlán—with seven distinct brands including Grand Luxxe, The Grand Bliss, The Grand Mayan, The Bliss, Mayan Palace, Sea Garden and Ocean Breeze. From AAA Five Diamond award-winning hotels to an internationally recognized collection of golf courses, Grupo Vidanta continually pioneers innovative partnerships. These world-class collaborations include Cirque du Soleil's JOYÀ, a first-of-its-kind theatrical and culinary experience in Riviera Maya; an exclusive agreement with global hospitality company Hakkasan Group to debut day-and-nightlife and dining experiences such as OMNIA Dayclub, Casa Calavera and SHOREbar at Vidanta Los Cabos; and an ongoing relationship with Nicklaus Design and Greg Norman Golf Course Design to create some of the world's most spectacular courses.   Grupo Vidanta's real estate division has built and sold over 2,000 luxury vacation homes and is responsible for developing Mexico's first privately built and owned airport, Mar de Cortés International Airport, in Puerto Peñasco.   Frequently named among the "Best Companies to Work for in Mexico," the organization maintains a strong commitment to its 17,000 employees and surrounding communities through its dedication to environmental and social efforts, including the Socially Responsible Distinctive 2018 granted by CEMEFI (Mexican Philanthropy Center), EarthCheck certifications and its long-established non-profit foundations, the Vidanta Foundation and the Delia Morán Vidanta Foundation. Grupo Vidanta announced the introduction of The Estates in 2019, a premier resort offering high-end details, plush amenities and lavish vacation experiences and will also expand into luxury cruise travel with the introduction of Vidanta Cruises in Fall 2019.

Description: Elepago is a mobile electronic payment platform allowing users to pay for services at bars, clubs and restaurants.

We have created an innovative payment process designed specifically for Mexico and Latin America. The first stage of Elepago is with the entertainment sector: restaurants, bars, and clubs. The user has access to his bill in real-time from his phone. Whenever ready, the user can set the tip and pay. The user charges his own credit/debit card; Elepago simply moves the money from user to commerce. By this innovative process, we avoid risk of error or fraud and save time for both users and restaurants. The top benefits of Elepago are (1) security, (2) convenience/time-saving, (3) targeted marketing through big data.

Description: Grupo México is a corporation in Mexico and the third largest copper producer in the world through ASARCO.
Full Description: The company was founded by Raul Antonio Escobedo and Larrea Mota Velasco in 1988. After the government of Carlos Salinas declared the state mining company bankrupt, Larrea purchased key Mexican copper mines in Cananea and Nacozari (cities in the state of Sonora). He also purchased numerous other mining sites, including coal mines in the state of Coahuila. By 2000, Grupo México was responsible for 87.5 percent of Mexico's copper production and is the world's third-largest copper producer in the world. Grupo México has been in continual conflict with Local 65, the Cananea branch of the Mexican Mine Workers' Union (SNTMMSRM). During miners' strikes in January 2003 and October 2004, Grupo México responded with threats to close the Cananea mines.  In 2004, Grupo México has also purchased a controlling interest in the Southern Peru Copper Corporation. Grupo Mexico acquired 54.2% equity interest in Southern Peru Copper Corporation from ASARCO LLC, a mining company operating in the United States. The SPCC equity sale is subject to a litigation between Grupo Mexico and ASARCO pending in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Texas under District Court Judge Andrew Hanen. As of September 2009, ASARCO was the focus of a bidding war begun in May 2008 between its own parent company Grupo México and India-based Sterlite Industries. On August 31, 2009, U.S. Bankruptcy Judge Richard Schmidt recommended that U.S. District Judge Andrew Hanen accept Grupo México's $2.5 billion bid for ASARCO as it prepares to come out of bankruptcy.
Founders: Larrea Mota Velasco, Raúl Antonio Escobedo

We provide the opportunity for over 2.5M unemployed people in Mexico (INEGI) to make more than 7k MXN monthly using their smartphone to make deliveries. There are currently more than 600M people living in LATAM—making us the region with the highest growth in smartphone usage. More than 100M smartphones were sold just in the last year, and it is estimated that the region will have over 500M smartphones in 2020. Latin America also has the second highest regional growth in ecommerce.

Description: Social-emotional learning program for 2-to-6-year-old children. Play-based methodology. In-home delivery.
Full Description: Strong academic focus and standardization in school, limit children from developing the skills they need to be successful in the digital age. Parents need after-school programs to complement their children’s development, but the existing offering is outdated and lacks personalization. Our methodology, Future-Ready Learning Experiences, developed by experts, is designed to help children develop Core Life Skills in healthy, fun and personalized environments. We are creating a tech-enabled community to connect teachers and parents at their own homes (e.g. Airbnb for after-school programs). To achieve a balanced and enjoyable lifestyle, modern parents are increasingly looking for convenient and easy-to-access services, including their children’s education. To meet parents’ demands, we empower, professionalize and certify, a literal tribe of teachers (Trybü Guides) to provide Future-Ready Learning Experiences at children’s homes. By 2029, we aim to empower and equip 100,000 young citizens for a fast-changing world.

Description: Smart health system
Full Description: Unfortunately, in Mexico only 5% of the population has access to a private health insurance. Everyone else, can have access to IMSS or ISSSTE. However, it is well-known that we are unhappy and unsatisfied with these institutions. At present doesn’t exist a prevention culture, if you don’t have healthy habits or if your genes simply are not on your favor, probably you could develop a complicated illness or health condition and next pay for medical attention in the private sector.  We are developing an integral system of digital health, that allows to: -	Access to a healthcare provider’s network that offer economical services for a timely attention. -	A lifetime of medical data integrated and the possibility of sharing the information with the patient’s healthcare providers. -	Predictive analysis to generate personalized follow-ups. -	To help create a prevention culture we offer free services as: o Medical advice in person and through telemedicine. o Initial check-up and blood tests. All those services are included in a Basic annual membership for $199.00 pesos. The health data digitalization has the potential to improve access to healthcare, reduce expenses, and to reach people who wouldn’t have access to services. Today we are playing a part in the creation of new health care models,  Do you join us?
Founders: Pablo Emmanuel Aguirre Zavala, Roberto Riestra Ruiz

Description: Get cash for every action on MiName.co.za when shopping around for the best products and services from great partners.
Full Description: How MiName Works? Search for Product In the past, direct marketing by phone, text or email has proven to be an annoyance for internet users, whose personal information is so casually shared amongst companies seeking a larger client base. In addition to being invasive to consumers, the companies trying to market themselves are spending good money on a form of marketing with a notoriously low conversion rate because of its lack of a specific, interested target market. MiName.co.za is an innovative recommendations site that turns a lose-lose situation into a mutually beneficial partnership between our partners and the consumers who are actively seeking their services. Whatever your industry, there’s no need to continue wasting resources with call centres which offer a notoriously low conversion rate. The advantages for consumers extend beyond increased privacy and internet searching convenience, too. MiName offers customers great money-back deals for signing up, making purchases, sharing their experience via social media and reviewing products. By choosing the companies that they would like to contact them, consumers have unprecedented online privacy of their personal details.
Industry Groups: Advertising, Commerce and Shopping, Sales and Marketing

Description: Social Marketplace where you can buy things without money!
Full Description: We are pioneering a new way of shopping known as e-social trading that delivers a smarter and more collaborative shopping experience.  Although the service is available for use by the general public, GivU (www.givu.mx) was specifically built and tailored to satisfy the shopping needs and wants of the millennial generation. To this generation of users, collaborating and engaging in the sharing economy are already the norm. Millennials have embraced the idea of community that the sharing economy is rooted in, and have a greater awareness of the environmental impacts of overconsumption compared with previous generations. GivU has demonstrated that it is not only possible, but also practical to buy products without spending your disposable income. Allowing GivU to offer a shopping alternative where customers are able to take care of their cash flow, while still enjoying the experience of buying and improving their quality of life.  www.givu.mx like a traditional e-commerce marketplace, rather than transacting in dollars users are required to sell a product to acquire credits known as Givs. One Giv is roughly equivalent to one USD and they are not exchangeable. GivU is a new social e-commerce platform where users can get products they want using the products they already own. GivU’s product catalog is built and brought to life by the community. The catalog increases as the community increases, providing a different window shopping experience every time a Giver goes into the platform. The site currently has more than 700 products that are either new or like new. This initial product offering is just the beginning of what promises to be a growing selection of technology and lifestyle products. GivU is a simple, fun, social shopping experience in a peer-to- peer marketplace where members can buy and sell lifestyle and entertainment products without money.
Industry Groups: Clothing and Apparel, Commerce and Shopping, Design, Media and Entertainment, Other

Description: A Cleaner, Healthier Tea Experience 100% Organic Matcha Tea.
Full Description: Matcha is 100% green tea leaves, ground to a fine powder. Real matcha comes from Japan. Their's from the Nishio region which is where the finest matcha is produced. Like all tea, matcha comes from the tea plant, but what makes matcha so special is that it's grown under shade for two weeks before plucking. This causes the tea plant to go into "overdrive" and produce high amounts of chlorophyll (the bright green stuff that contains all the nutrients). The tea is then ground by granite stones to form a very fine powder so when you drink it you ingest all of the leaf and all of it's nutrients. This makes it very, very healthy. In fact, just one serving of matcha contains 15x the health benefits of regular green tea, 70x the antioxidants of orange juice, and 9x the beta carotene of spinach. In other words, drinking matcha is a fantastic way to help you achieve a cleaner, healthier lifestyle.

Ficus is born to create a community that can share wisdom with the use of technology, connecting individuals with hunger to learn and share knowledge. It simplifies and automates the logistics process Consolhub platform provide instantly to the shipper a range option in terms of the shipping companies (consolidators), departure dates, transit days, routes and price. The platform (consolhub.com) allows buyers to search for routes, pricing, itineraries and, then, securely book and upload all the documentation required. The advantages to the shippers (buyers) from using Consolhub include:  •	Time savings: less phone calls and emails to get the best options •	24/7 service: an online platform to book 24/7, where all the processes are automated and documents are managed online, saving more time and reducing errors •	Access to better prices
Industry Groups: Commerce and Shopping, Internet Services, Transportation, Travel and Tourism

Description: Kerbal Space Program is a space flight simulator developed by Squad.
Full Description: Kerbal Space Program is a space flight simulator developed by Squad for Microsoft Windows, OS X, Linux, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and Wii U. In the game, the player controls a nascent space program operated by Kerbals who have constructed a fully furnished and functional spaceport on their homeworld Kerbin, similar to Earth. The gameplay consists of constructing rockets and spaceplanes out of a provided set of components and launching them from the in-game space center’s launch pad or runway, then going on to complete their desired mission while averting catastrophic failure such as running out of fuel or electricity, or the spacecraft breaking apart due to structural problems, otherwise being unable to succeed. Its missions include achieving orbit, landing on the Mun or Minmus (Kerbin’s two moons), landing on any of the other 13 stock planets and moons such as Duna or Eve, capturing asteroids, and creating space stations and bases.
Transaction Name: Kerbal Space Program acquired by Take-Two Interactive

Description: We are a traveltech Company. Our software allows our users to save for their next vacations, either alone or in groups.
Full Description: We’re an innovative company in the tourism sector through three strands, Fintech, Traveltech and E-Commerce. Did you know that… Only 20% of people who would like to travel actually do so? This exclusive group of people who manage to make their trip, buy their tickets through one of the many travel agencies in Mexico. But, what about the 80% who had to postpone their trip? Dooddo was born to solve the 3 main problems that cause people to postpone their trip:  1.	Organization 2.	High travel prices 3.	Limited acquisition capacity We’re dooddo.com We’re the first Fintech company in Mexico focused on travel with 2 years in the market (one year for development and establishing and another one operating). In this short period of time we’ve reached a 4 million MXN pesos earning through active customers registered in our saving digital platform that have already traveled with us.  We have national and international suppliers that allow us to create and organize the best experience for clients. We serve two types of clients: 1.	Travelers without a destination, organization skills or the capacity to pay for the whole trip at once. Our digital platform takes care of the trip organization giving the user an estimate budget through its algorithm for their trip, so they can start saving monthly until they reach their goal. They can invite their friends or family to start a group saving and see their advance in real time, once they reach the 50% your goal, they’ll start to receive the best deals on flights and lodgings for the destination they picked. We organize intelligently any type of trip such as: 	Bachelors parties  	Vacation trips 	Graduations 	Sports events 	Music festivals 	Family trips 	Honeymoons  ¡To any place in the world! 2.	Travelers who know where they want to go and want the best price for the whole trip. They can arrange their trip through our travel agency getting the best promotions paying with any type of credit card or cash.
Industry Groups: Commerce and Shopping, Content and Publishing, Financial Services, Media and Entertainment, Travel and Tourism

Description: City Express Hotels is the best choice for business, has more than 96 hotels in Mexico, Costa Rica and Colombia.
Full Description: City Express Hotels is a Mexican company founded in 2002 with the goal of serving a strategic market niche within the hotel industry: the economic segment of the business traveler. In 2003 they opened their first hotel under the brand City Express. A year later, the City Suites brand was born, and in 2008 they introduced the City Junior brand. Today, with more than 96 hotels and a broad presence in Mexico, City Hotels is the chain with the fastest growth in Mexico. Additionally, their chain is the first and only one in Latin America to obtain LEED (Leadership and Energy in Environmental Design) Certification, which was granted to their City Express hotel in San Luis Potosi. At all their hotels they have attained notable level environmental efficiency thanks to the implementation of a comprehensive water- and energy-savings program, emissions reductions, waste management, and care of natural resources. The high quality standards in design, construction, sustainability, and safety, combined with a team of workers with extensive careers in the industry, have made City Hotels one of the best alternative options for lodging for business travelers, and one of the best investment options for those who wish to increase their capital through a modern, innovative franchise and a leader in the business traveler market.

Description: CIMMYT is a non-profit research and training center headquartered in Mexico. (The abbreviation CIMMYT derives from the Spanish version of
Full Description: CIMMYT is a non-profit research and training center headquartered in Mexico. (The abbreviation "CIMMYT" derives from the Spanish version of our name: Centro Internacional de Mejoramiento de Maíz y Trigo.) Our Mission: To sustainably increase the productivity of maize and wheat systems to ensure global food security and reduce poverty Vision and strategic goal: CIMMYT works with and brings together public research and extension organizations, private companies, advanced research institutes, NGOs, and farmer associations in countries worldwide, working pragmatically and apolitically to fight hunger and poverty. The Center applies the best science to develop and freely share: * High-yielding, stress tolerant maize and wheat varieties. * Large, unique collections of maize and wheat genetic resources. * Productivity-enhancing, resource-conserving farming practices. * Training and information relating to the above. Through these activities and outputs, CIMMYT works to foster global and local food security, helping farmers meet rapidly rising demand from expanding populations and affluence, while addressing the emerging challenges of global climate change and resource degradation and scarcities.
